section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Fair average value" means the average of the fair value of stock in business for the number of months of a year in which the stock in business was in existence.
"Fair value" means the lesser of the cost or the value of stock in business.

"Stock in business":
means the inventory of a commercial or manufacturing business that is engaged in business in this State; and
does not include a used motor vehicle of a registered motor vehicle dealer if that vehicle is:
titled in this State; and
acquired by a dealer as partial payment of the purchase price of another motor vehicle.

text.section: Stock in business shall be valued to the owner of the stock in business at its fair average value on the date of finality.
